title: lyzether
author: lyzether

comments.author: Delightcrypto1
comments.body: Better for you. But still at the bear market a lot of investors are still making it. But if you aren't good enough in trading please save your asset as stable coin or else you will loose it all at this period.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Should you really show the amount? Be careful when doing that online if that was really your money because you could be targeted by some hackers and scammers.I don't think it makes much of a difference between USDT and USDC. Maybe just look into the companies that issues each stable coin and choose who you trust more. I know Tether has had plenty of accusation compared to Circle and Coinbase but both companies seems liquid enough to support a 1:1 redemption or close.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Whether it can be USDT or USDC they are both the same but for the sake of putting eggs in many baskets...why not entertain the idea of putting half in USDT and the other half in USDC? Having said that...congratulations on finding a very creative way of advertising Natomi. I know you are just posting that for the sake of promoting that site. Anyway, good luck and more power.

comments.author: lyzether
comments.body: ok i will change it to USDC and stake it again thanks

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: lyzether on June 17, 2022, 10:14:37 AMok i will change it to USDC and stake it again thanksWherever you are comfortable with, they're both stable coins and just be aware that there are other stable coins that are de-pegging their values from the USD. I'm curious and probably worried as well about that website where you're staking your USDT/USDC. Well, it's not actually staking but you're letting them borrow your money so that's an interest account just like what the banks do.

comments.author: Queenboss
comments.body: Staking of USDT is the best move for now. There's really no much difference between the two because they're both stable and since you've already staked your USDT, just continue with it. That's a more reliable source of passive income and the value would be growing, as long as it takes the market to complete this cycle.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: Quote from: lyzether on June 16, 2022, 04:13:12 PM I stake most of my USDT,it is better to leave it as USDT or change it to USDC ? Nice $88 in 8 days, that seem profitable. I'm beginning to suspect you are shilling that Natomi  protocol.Let me just remind you that most of the defi/lending and borrowing platform could go bankrupt soon. Look at, Luna, Celsius and probably Blockfi may follow soon. In the case of USDT, its safer to use USDC or so they say because its more transparent and coinbase has backed their reserves unlike USDT which is not. Also USDT is not safe, they have once frozen funds, you'll never know when they suddenly lose knots.

comments.author: fosco333
comments.body: Did you do this on purpose ? There are many scammers promote their project with this way.Im sorry but you are very suspicious, a newbie should not put their money too much on a project like natomi which is still not well known.It would be a different story if you showed that you stake your money on Binance.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Beware @OP is spreading a fraudulent site.See my feedback on the @OP account. And especially this: https://ninjastic.space/post/60374319, I gave a warning in the last OP thread, but he delete the last thread.

comments.author: ije07
comments.body: Usdt and Usdc are both stable coins but they still have differences between the two, Usdt has high liquidity compared to Usdc but in terms of usdc exchange there is no minimum requirement and is backed up by Coinbase so I feel comfortable using Usdc instead of USD so it's better to just replace the asset and use Usdc for the investment tools you make on the platform, Btw nice Apy that is provided on the platform.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: If you are in for a long term let us say 5 years, then it is better to be converted to BTC.  At the current price, BTC is on sale.  Many may find the current BTC market frightening but if you are around and witnessed two bitcoin halving then you won't worry about the current crash of BTC but rather look at it as an opportunity to buy at a discounted price.

comments.author: saint_casanova
comments.body: Quote from: lyzether on June 16, 2022, 04:13:12 PMSafeMoon sfm Uhm guy, did we trigger some fail check and OP was just a bot, delete all his content right away?I just hit a F5 on the thread, thought I would jump in the conversation and read all posts, bam "SafeMoon sfm". Pretty spooky.

comments.author: Mosharafhh
comments.body: Dont invest on any types of coin or token now market condition is very bad only you can do now is convert your coin into any stable coin and hold for reinvest in bull season now winter is starting i think!!
